headline: Is A Stock Market Crash In Sight? Insiders Are Bailing At The Fastest Pace Since 2021
summary: The U.S. stock market has been on a tear for more than three years — but the people running America's biggest companies are suddenly selling into the strength at a pace not seen since the last major market peak. Corporate insider selling has surged to its highest sell‑to‑buy ratio in five years, according to data cited by Maverick Equity Research. In an X.com post, the firm warned that "U.S. Corporate Insiders like & love the current high valuations as they are quite selling: highest Selling/Buy

headline: Novo Nordisk has published its annual report for 2025
summary: Bagsværd, Denmark, 4 February 2026 – Today, Novo Nordisk A/S has issued its 2025 annual report. The report is available here: https://www.novonordisk.com/investors/annual-report.html and is attached in iXBRL format. Novo Nordisk is a leading global healthcare company founded in 1923 and headquartered in Denmark. Our purpose is to drive change to defeat serious chronic diseases built upon our heritage in diabetes. We do so by pioneering scientific breakthroughs, expanding access to our medicines

headline: Anthropic's new AI tools deepen selloff in data analytics and software stocks, investors say
summary: A significant selloff among U.S. and European data analytics, professional services and software companies deepened on Tuesday, with some investors pointing to a recently updated artificial intelligence chatbot by Anthropic as ​the main culprit.  AI developer Anthropic launched plug-ins for its Claude Cowork agent on Friday that would automate tasks across legal, sales, marketing and ‌data analysis.  Toronto-based Thomson Reuters, which owns the Westlaw legal database, slumped by nearly 18%.

content.title: Anthropic's new AI tools deepen selloff in data analytics and software stocks, investors say
content.summary: A significant selloff among U.S. and European data analytics, professional services and software companies deepened on Tuesday, with some investors pointing to a recently updated artificial intelligence chatbot by Anthropic as ​the main culprit.  AI developer Anthropic launched plug-ins for its Claude Cowork agent on Friday that would automate tasks across legal, sales, marketing and ‌data analysis.  Toronto-based Thomson Reuters, which owns the Westlaw legal database, slumped by nearly 18%.

headline: Alphabet Looks Stronger Ahead of Earnings. Focus Is on the Cloud.
summary: A year ago,  Alphabet’s  core property, Google Search, looked like it was in trouble.  Despite a decade of well-funded research on artificial intelligence, Google was still surprised by the capabilities of ChatGPT when it debuted in November 2022.  Google struggled to match AI models coming out of start-ups OpenAI and Anthropic, and web search was changing.

content.title: Alphabet Looks Stronger Ahead of Earnings. Focus Is on the Cloud.
content.summary: A year ago,  Alphabet’s  core property, Google Search, looked like it was in trouble.  Despite a decade of well-funded research on artificial intelligence, Google was still surprised by the capabilities of ChatGPT when it debuted in November 2022.  Google struggled to match AI models coming out of start-ups OpenAI and Anthropic, and web search was changing.

headline: Meta Faces Child Safety Privacy And Patent Tests For Future Growth
summary: Meta Platforms is entering a landmark child exploitation trial in New Mexico focused on alleged harms linked to its social platforms. In the United States, Meta is facing a new patent infringement lawsuit tied to smart glasses technology used in its Reality Labs business. headline: Shoptalk Announces Initial Speakers for 2026 Spring Event in Las Vegas
summary: NEW YORK, February 04, 2026--Shoptalk, the leading global event for retail innovation, today announced the initial speaker lineup for its 2026 spring conference taking place March 24–26 at Mandalay Bay in Las Vegas. Featuring more than 50 sessions, the conference will bring together more than 10,000 attendees, with one in three holding a C-suite role at a retailer, consumer brand or tech company.

content.title: Shoptalk Announces Initial Speakers for 2026 Spring Event in Las Vegas
content.summary: NEW YORK, February 04, 2026--Shoptalk, the leading global event for retail innovation, today announced the initial speaker lineup for its 2026 spring conference taking place March 24–26 at Mandalay Bay in Las Vegas. Featuring more than 50 sessions, the conference will bring together more than 10,000 attendees, with one in three holding a C-suite role at a retailer, consumer brand or tech company.

headline: Oracle’s Massive AI Push Weighs On Jobs Valuation And Balance Sheet Risks
summary: Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) is pursuing a US$45b to US$50b capital raise, split roughly between debt and equity, tied to large AI and cloud infrastructure plans. The company is weighing up to 30,000 job cuts and a potential sale of its Oracle Health (Cerner) unit as part of a broad restructuring. These moves are linked to fulfilling major cloud and AI infrastructure commitments for clients including OpenAI, Meta, and Nvidia. Oracle, known for its database software and cloud services, is pushing...

headline: Snap reports upbeat fourth-quarter revenue as holiday season boosts ad spending
summary: Snap beat Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter revenue, as more advertisers turned to the social media platform during the holiday season, sending its ​shares up over 5% in extended trading.  The Snapchat-parent said total active advertisers on ‌the platform rose 28% in the fourth quarter, underscoring strength in direct response ads and growth in new ad ‌formats such as Sponsored Snaps and Promoted Places.  The results come as a relief for investors as advertisers increasingly rely on platforms such as Meta and TikTok, which are preferred due to their larger user base.

content.title: Snap reports upbeat fourth-quarter revenue as holiday season boosts ad spending
content.summary: Snap beat Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter revenue, as more advertisers turned to the social media platform during the holiday season, sending its ​shares up over 5% in extended trading.  The Snapchat-parent said total active advertisers on ‌the platform rose 28% in the fourth quarter, underscoring strength in direct response ads and growth in new ad ‌formats such as Sponsored Snaps and Promoted Places.  The results come as a relief for investors as advertisers increasingly rely on platforms such as Meta and TikTok, which are preferred due to their larger user base.

headline: Snap Stock Pops After Surprise Earnings Beat
summary: Snap  reported a surprise profit for its latest quarter, boosting the stock in after hours trading on Wednesday. headline: Tesla's Daring Move
summary: For several years, Tesla has been straddling the fence between an electric vehicle manufacturer and its ambition to pursue autonomous driving and humanoid robots. Its most recent quarterly report looks like the sign that the company has picked a side. Plus, the ups and downs of Meta's and Microsoft's earnings.

content.title: Tesla's Daring Move
content.summary: For several years, Tesla has been straddling the fence between an electric vehicle manufacturer and its ambition to pursue autonomous driving and humanoid robots. Its most recent quarterly report looks like the sign that the company has picked a side. Plus, the ups and downs of Meta's and Microsoft's earnings.

headline: Alphabet’s Cloud Is Shining as CapEx Heads Even Higher
summary: Google parent-company  Alphabet  reported solid fourth-quarter earnings results Wednesday afternoon.  Investors were likely more interested in the company’s forecast for expanded 2026 capital expenditure spending, which the company now sees at  $175 to $185 billion, well in excess of expectations of around $115 billion.  Google Cloud saw revenue of $17.7 billion, up 48% year-over-year and well ahead of Wall Street consensus.

headline: 'Melania' Surprises With $7 Million In US, Film Made Only $44,960 In UK, $7,696 In Italy: Why Amazon Is Far From Profits

headline: PayPal Leadership Shake-Up - Former HP Exec Hired As New CEO
summary: PayPal Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:PYPL) shares are down during premarket trading on Tuesday following the announcement of a leadership change within the company. The stock’s decline comes as the company appointed Enrique Lores as its new President and CEO, effective Mar. 1. The Board of Directors expressed confidence that Lores will lead PayPal into its next chapter, but uncertainty often accompanies such changes. headline: Analysts flag alarming correlation amid tech sell-off
summary: The tech sell-off continued on Wall Street as the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite and the S&P 500 benchmark sank on Feb. 4. While the former was down 1.8%, the latter was down 0.6% at press time. Nearly all the Magnificent Seven stocks were trading in the red zone at the time of writing. ...

headline: Snap reports upbeat revenue as holiday season fuels ad sales
summary: Snap beat Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter revenue, as more advertisers turned to the social media platform during the holiday season, ​sending its shares up over 2% in extended trading.  The Snapchat-parent said total active advertisers ‌on the platform rose 28% in the fourth quarter, underscoring strength in direct response ads and growth in new ‌ad formats such as Sponsored Snaps and Promoted Places.  The results calm investor jitters as advertisers increasingly rely on platforms such as Meta and TikTok, which are preferred due to their larger user base.

The results calm investor jitters as advertisers increasingly rely on platforms such as Meta and TikTok, which are preferred due to their larger user base.
